text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 39 in today's
episode I have a new word for you
impeccable let's find out what it means
and how you can use this word in your
daily conversation impeccable sometimes
certain things seem to be just perfect
such as an absolute idea a perfect
personality of a person or anything that
appeals to you and is free from errors
sometimes everything is perfect in every
way
impeccable basically means something
that is perfect or extraordinary in
other words it means something that is
without any fault or error don't we all
want our performances at work to be
impeccable that means you want your
performance to be perfect we all want to
have an impeccable approach towards life
in order to make our lives worth living
when you pay through your nose at a
five-star hotel you always expect
impeccable service in short impeccable
means something that is flawless or free
from any faults as the word impeccable
describes something or someone being
perfect it is an adjective
all right now that you know what
impeccable means to understand this word
better let's take a look at how you can
use it in your daily conversation
example one we got an impeccable deal
for this apartment I couldn't have asked
for more example till my grandfather had
always been admired for his impeccable
style of dressing example 3 what an
impeccable timing my flight had landed
in the city just before it started to
rain example for mr. David always
achieves his sales target due to his
impeccable marketing skills it's very
hard for a customer to turn him down
example 5 Stacey was dressed impeccably
for the dance show everyone noticed how
perfect she looked example 6 the
impeccable launch of Windows 8 mobile
phone by Microsoft's chief executive
officer Ballmer left the audience
speechless example 7 we saw an
impeccable piece of artwork at the
exhibition today example 8 in today's
competitive world if you don't offer
impeccable services to your customers
they are likely to be put off for life
example nine the virgin olive oil is
known for its impeccable taste and aroma
